author: Special Correspondent
text:
Ruling party MLA G. Nehru alias Kuppusamy seems to be continuing in the post of Government Whip still even though he tendered his resignation nearly four months ago.

Diary released by govt.

The diary released by the Government run Directorate of Stationery and Printing is an affirmation he still continues in the post.

It was in protest against the “secrecy” shrouding the selection of candidate to Rajya Sabha poll that Mr. Nehru tendered the resignation to Chief Minister on September 6. Subsequently, Mr. Nehru resorted to several protests against the government.

Facilities surrendered

When contacted, Mr. Nehru stated that he “had resigned the post last September and surrendered the car and other facilities extended to Government Whip. I don’t know whether they accepted my letter or not but I continue as peoples’ representative. I am discharging my duty duly as an MLA.”

Sources, meanwhile, confirmed that the resignation of Mr. Nehru was not accepted.
title: Nehru ‘continues’ in post even after resignation
